Reviews.Title: “Rome central, 10 mins - reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: AlanWill
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day trip in Rome and stayed in the Hotel. Whilst others have commented on the room size, I would agree they are tight, but we were only sleeping there, so no big problem for me? The staff were always available, polite and helpfull if asked. The buffet breakfast was typical for the type of Hotel and more than what we required. The room was tidied everyday, with clean towels being provided. Interent was available and the Wi-Fi worked fine in the room. Termini station is about 15 mins walk and the nearest metro 5 mins from the Hotel. There is a great choice of restauraunts (at least 15-20) all within an easy 10 min walk, which suited us after a hard day sightseeing. The nearest is directly across the street where we found the staff very friendly and spoke english well. There is a local bar right next door open till 3 a.m. which we did use and whilst we were roomed on the first floor (102) certainly never heard any noise. In fact we found the street very quite and an excellent location overall. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: bazin78
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, one of the best hotel experience in Rome. The hotel is in a quite calm area, although it is only ten walking minutes distant from Roma Termini station. For 90 Euro, I received a quite big room, great breakfast (compared to other Best western hotels). Few Remarks: the shower had some problems in draining water.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Aldo G
Reviews.Content: Last november I stayed at Villafranca, and I have to say that this is a gem. The location is perfect (10 minutes walk from Termini or 2 metro stops away) in a very quiet area, where no traffic will bother you, yet very close to most roman attractions. The customer service is great, and the breakfast is better than other properties nearby. I will be staying again in this hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Me M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four days in April and would not return. The beds are not comfortable and the sheets were not changed once during our 4 day stay. There is a club/bar near the hotel so you can hear a great deal of noise. The shower door is too small the water leaks out of the shower, there is no vent in the restroom. The hotel has a distinct (not good) smell. The breakfast looks pretty but taste horrible, I guess it is ok if you like canned meat heated to room temperature and 3rd quality fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Caution: Bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed at this hotel for one week. Overall I have a positive impression of this hotel. Central location, friendly staff, good breakfast. I don't know if other floors are affected as well, but I wish you good luck if you land on the 5th floor. This is where I had my room. My arms and shoulders are now covered with bites and I even catched some of those insects alive (see pictures). I checked over internet... so it is 100% sure, these are bed bugs. The front desk clerks could only offer me a free night next time I come. But I doubt I will be coming there again...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: staceyhughes26
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Villafranca hotel between 12th March and 16th March as a treat for my 21st birthday. We booked through Thomas Cook and could not have had a better time! We arrived in the afternoon after a slight delay on our flight, and were greeted by a very friendly gentlemen who spoke English very well, which was a relief as my italian is limited! He took our details, and sorted out our room within seconds. He directed us to our room, and informed us of breakfast timings and location. Before travelling i emailed the hotel in order to request a room on a high floor with a balcony. We were given room 608. On a high floor and with a balcony, just what we asked for!! The room was of adequate sizing.....its not like we spent much time in the room with all the sights to see! The bed in the room as amazing! was definately bigger than a normal double bed, maybe king sized? me and my partner always slept well and spread out as much as we wanted without kicking each other, which is what usually happens! The bathroom was generously sized also, with plenty of towels and toiletries provided. Breakfast was good with a range of pastries, cereals, fruit, yoghurts, and a small amount of hot food. on our third day we needed to phone up to confirm our private transfer to the airport at the end of the stay. I was nervous about this because as previously mentioned, i am not the best at speaking italian! I went to reception with all the details and asked if it was possible for them to confirm my booking for me. The gentlemen on reception was extremely helpful, took the paperwork and promptly phoned up while we waited, confirming our booking and giving us a pick time also. When we returned later from sight seeing and collected our key from reception, i was given an envelope, which contained email confirmation from the transfer company which the hotel had printed out for me. Check out was easy and painless also. As our flight was an evening flight, we checked out at 12 and the hotel was happy to look after our luggage whilst we finished souvenir shopping. We found the hotel to be perfectly situated. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, including Mama Angelas which is well worth a visit! it is located about a 10 minute walk from the termini, which is close enough for sight seeing, yet does not affect the hotel in terms of noise. The hotel is in an area which is not too busy and is unaffected by traffic noise, apart from the ambulance sirens, which i think you'd hear no matter where you stayed in Rome! Overall i would not hesitate to stay at the Villafranca again, and am hoping to stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending the Villafranca”
Reviews.Author: TraveladdictDerby
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay coincided with my birthday and we were welcomed on arrival with a bottle of bubbly. A very nice touch. A few days before our trip I emailed the hotel to request a room with a balcony and also to ask for tea/coffee making facilities. We got both and although having a large balcony meant we had a smaller room it was very clean and well equipped with a fridge, a safe, TV and a very nice bathroom. Having free WIFI is a great bonus & we didn't have any problems connecting on the 6th floor. Like other reviewers have said the location is excellent. We caught the bus from the Termini for €1 to the Vatican but we walked back to the hotel. The map given to us on arrival was extremely useful. We also walked to the Spanish Steps, the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and even up to the Villa Borghese which is well worth a visit on a Sunday afternoon. All single trips are €1 but if you like walking there is so much to see en route. All in all the Villafranca is a little gem within reach of all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sds15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a 4 night break, location was great as we were able to walk from Rome termini station in about 5 minutes. On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff. Our room was on the 1st floor and although small was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean, with almost everything you needed, (a kettle / teamaking facilities would be nice though) the bed was the hardest bed I had ever "slept" in though. (room 107) As smokers we requested a smoking room and were told that we could move onto the 6th floor the following day and to leave our luggage in the room and a porter would transfer it for us whilst we were out. The room on the 6th floor (602) was even nicer (the walls were fabric panelled rather than just painted and the bedding was matching, very plush and the very large bed was sooo comfortable, again it was spotleesly clean and we had maid service every day with fresh towels etc. and automatic lighting in the coridors / bathroom. We had a balcony but mainly rooftop views, but we werent there to admire the view from the hotel anyway. Breakfast was self service with a great choice, either hot or cold, and the table was cleared of used crockery as soon as you'd finished, the staff worked extremely efficiently. Overall we would definatly stay here again, the staff were very pleasant and helpful, clean rooms and good location for main station and underground Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice although a bit cramped.”
Reviews.Author: DaisyHastings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villafranca for three nights in February and posisbly because we had requested a double room rather than a twin, found the room a little small even by Roman standards. However, all we really needed was a base and breakfast so it was not a problem and the bed was very comfortable - we slept better than at home! The shower, though, was really very cramped and had no shelf inside for toiletries which would have been a help. The hotel is easy to find and only a short walk from the Termini station. There are a number of eateries nearby of varying standards and price (we would particularly recommend Il Leone d'Abruzzo) and it is not too long a walk to most of the major attractions of this wonderful city. Reception staff were helpful and the hotel itself is clean and modern, although the lifts often go up and down a few times while you wait to keep up with demand. Our room was at the front on the second floor (so we didn't use the lifts that much) - I imagine that in high season it could be quite noisy from street sounds but was not too bad at this time of year. The spread for breakfast was wide and varied but not topped up that well - they serve between 7am and 10am but if you are any later than around 9am the food starts to run out and not be replaced. The breakfast area is also quite small and on Sunday morning, when everyone was getting ready to eat and check out, there were not enough tables at some points. Hot and cold foods - scrambled egg, sausage and bacon, cold meats and cheeses, toast and bread, rolls, cakes and biscuits, fresh and tinned fruit, yoghurt, cereals, coffees etc from machines, and fruit juices. Enough to keep you going without lunch! The room was clean and fresh towels were provided every day if needed. The bedside drawers did contain items from the previous occupants and there are not really enough drawers if you are there for more than a few days. However it did seem that we had the smallest room on the floor so perhaps other rooms have more storage space. We would not have chosen this hotel had it been our own decision (it was part of a package) but it was perfectly reasonable and if we wanted to stay in that area of the city again, we would consider the Villafranca - but maybe ask for a larger room!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: tiamia111
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights staying here with friends. We were given rooms 701 and 703 which were on the very top floor. 701 was overlooking the side of building with a very small balcony, but the views were pretty of rooftops. One issue for the room is the shower which is only a mixer tap over the bath and was faulty so we basically had to stand holding the shower head for the entire time making washing my hair very difficult. Another issue with the hotel was I could not get wifi at all in my room despite reception telling me I should. Was a bit frustrating as I'd taken my iPad to keep in touch back home but wifi worked in and around reception and the bar so wasn't the end of the world. We we checked in by Marco and Ameliano who pretty much manned reception thought our stay. They were great, very friendly, spoke excellent English and always happy to help us with our questions. We were unfortunately there for the snow and being a freezer I mentioned I was a little cold. Within ten minutes we were given extra blankets which was much appreciated. There is a barman there called Chokan who I have to tell you is fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble day or night for him and was always very accommodating. The friendliness of the staff are in my opinion what makes this hotel a great stay. Chokans friendliness was what made our stay so very warm and welcoming. We used the bus from the airport which goes directly from the airport to the termini. It was then a good five minute walk to the hotel. The colleseum was about 30 minutes away walking and as all the tour busses travel via the termini it does make the hotel a fairly good spot. We also found even when we went walking and got lost, being right by the termini was a good landmark to head back to. Breakfast is really good with cereals, toast meats and a few pastries. You can also have a fresh coffee made free of charge at breakfast if you ask. Breakfast was so good we only needed an evening meal as it kept us going on day. We didn't get to see everything and we truly fell in love with Rome so fully intend on going back and in all probability we would use this hotel again. I would ask for a different room though as the lower rooms did have much bigger balconies and hopefully the wifi works better. The only other thing we would have liked was a few more English channels on the tv as BBC World news or CNN, which were the only choices got a little boring but that's just a niggle as we didn't really go on holiday to watch tv.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: tollyg
Reviews.Content: Great location for a sight seeing trip to Rome as close to Termini station and metro. Had no issues with the hotel, reception staff were great. Asked for kettle in the room, it arrived in 5 min, problem with aircon not heating again fixed in minutes. In addition to the typical continental breakfast there were also scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. Considering the price we paid for the whole package trip from the UK the hotel was much better than we could have expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast, descent location, hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: LeanneOnAStar
Reviews.Content: We decided to use some racked up points during our stay in Rome, and got this hotel for free for a few days. The location is pretty good- short walk (very do-able with normal size luggage) to the train station. Felt safe at night. We had arrived with a rental car having driven from Amalfi.. and had a parking spot right out front.. p.s. NEVER rent a car in Rome!!!! The front staff seemed very cold but they did their job and got us our keys quickly. The room was very small, and the bed hard as anything... but clean and generally typical european standards. the best part was the breakfast. They have machines to make you own coffee and nice cheeses and meats, breads, fruits, yogurt... and it was nice to sit with all the various travelers in the brekfast room. If you get a good enough deal and are looking for a place near the termini then I do suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and good location”
Reviews.Author: anggingyin
Reviews.Content: Best Western Villafranca is conveniently located near the Roma Termini station (about 5 minutes walk) and Metro Line B station. It is easy to get around and accessible to major attractions via the Metro. In addition, there are a lot of restaurants selection and supermarket in the vicinity so it is perfect for travelers in Rome. The room is modern, clean, with good amenities thereby offering good value. I enjoyed the sumptuous spread of the buffet breakfast, overall good Best Western style hotel. A tip to get to the hotel from Roma Termini, when you exit the station, turn left and walk along Via Marsala. When you see Via Vicenza, turn right and walk until you see Via Villafranca, you will see the hotel on your left.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: lonzie
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk from Termini train station and walking distance from the main attractions means this hotel is well located. The rooms are adequate as is the breakfast and wi-fi is free throughout the hotel. If you want a bit of luxury then I'd look elsewhere but for the price in Rome then this does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: NST_ram
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid November for 3 nights. Location is outside the centre but if reasonably fit not too far to walk to the main attractions. From my point of view it meant eating out was quite reasonabley priced with plenty of choice just a few yards from the hotel. Also the Train station was just far enough as this is not the most pleasant of places in the evening. The comments about the hotel from other guests are quite mixed. Our room was not perfect but it was also by no means the worst room we have ever stayed in. We managed to get a room with a terrace which was fantastic - even in mid Nov. and the room (althoug compact was clean with a reasonable size bathroom). We were directly opposite the lifts which I had concerns over but to be fair we never heard them or other guests (may have just been lucky though !) The only drawback was the heating being too high and noisy which required three attempts with reception to resolve (and eventually took my wife requesting in Italian to get it resolved !) The staff we dealt with were helpful and polite and we were given a map as soon as we checked in which was a godsend. Breakfast was plentiful and again during our meals the staff were polite and attentive who were continually cleaning / filling up so I have no complaints there. Overall we enjoyed our stay and I would probably stay here again - my score would reasonably 3.5

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: UK50scouple
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually a 3+++ grade. It is v conveniently located 5 mins from Termini.Our room was perfectly;y adequate with a balcony that we used each day to enjoy the still warm mid November sun. As previously reported tea and coffee making facilities available on request. Reception staff very helpful contradicting other reviewers comments. Loads of restaurants within 100 metres, you need to explore a three hundred metre radius of the hotel to experience the full range available. For the young or young at heart try the Yellow Bar which is very close Cheap drinks and a young crowd many of whom are residents of the Yellow Travellers Hostel. When we visited loads of young Americans were in residence and a very friendly crowd they were too. I would recommend this hotel Its good value and yes the breakfasts were A1.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: HellsBellsBelfast
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night break in the Villafranca. We arrived very late at night following a delayed flight and found the hotel fairly easily. Our check in was quick and painless and we found our room to be slightly small but very clean. The room was cleaned every day and we also received clean towels every day. We spent very little time in the hotel as we spent most of our time sightseeing but we found the room to be comfortable and the breakfast to be great. Although we did not have many dealings with staff, anyone we spoke to was pleasant and helpful. The only slight problem we found with the hotel was that the walls were very thin. We wakened very confused early one morning with next door's alarm going off! The hotel is located less than 5 minutes from the Termini station and we walked easily to the colloseum. We did get lazy after a tiring first day and used the metro to go everywhere after that. It only cost 1 euro per trip but you could also buy a day ticket for unlimited use. The metro was easy to use and easy to find in the Termini. There are plenty of restaurants in the surrounding area, including one directly across the street (3 arches) that was very nice. The only problem we had with the area was the lack of nightlife. There is a bar in the next street, which was part of the Yellow hostel, that was decent - good cocktails and modern music. Apart from this we walked to the Fiddlers Elbow which is beside Santa Maria Maggiore church, about 20 minutes walk away. We walked there and back quite late at night and felt perfectly safe although we were careful with bags everywhere in Rome after hearing a few horror stories. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good sightseeing base however the area itself was a bit quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers?”
Reviews.Author: Swineton
Reviews.Content: There are so many things wrong with this hotel I don’t know where to start. Reception was just awful. Unfriendly, unhelpful and just didn’t care. Getting directions was like extracting teeth. We asked for a map and were told they didn’t have any. We walked by a few minutes later to find them giving one to another couple. The first room they tried to give us had peeling paint and cracks in the wall. We complained and got a slightly better room. So much for recently being refurbished! The lifts broke down the second day we were there and it took all week to get both working again. Wi fi only worked in the lounge area. To get a good signal you had to be within five feet of the modem. Some bright spark decided to fit sensor lights in the corridors (by itself not a bad idea). Unfortunately they installed dark blue carpet and painted the walls a dark maroon colour. As a result the place is poorly lit and looks dark and dirty. To make matter worse they also installed a sensor light just as you enter the room right next to the bathroom. Of course if someone got up in the night to go to the toilet, the light turned on. Really clever! Cleaning the lounge area was obviously not a priority for them. We went out at ten one day and came back at six. The same cups etc were still sitting there. Breakfast was nothing short of a debacle. Coffee machines that didn’t work, dirty plates left on tables and food constantly running out. In all honestly I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to my mother-in-law.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this place...great location, clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: easylike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for a 3 night stay that I had in September. Location is just 5 mins walk from Termini, but is in a quiet small street off of Via Valencia, so you are not in the middle of hustle,bustle an noise. Inside it looks like it has been modernised tastefully and was very clean. the buffet breakfast and had loads of choice. In my opinion it was perfect for the proce. The hotel staff were great and gave us some great reccomendations. One of which was the Taverna Pretoriana in Via Palestro. A wonderful restaurant in Via Palestro. Nothing special to look at with 70's style wooden veneer. But the food and service were fabulous. And the place was full of locals so that tells its own story. Its not huge or grand in the style of a large branded hotel. But has enough character, charm and quality to earn a high recommendation. I really cannot think of anything negative to say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityTrav67
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the hotel. Hotel is good located 15 min walk from Termini railwaystation and 2 min walk to the nearest metrostation. It is a nice hotel with a modern lobby, breakfast area and small bar. We stayed on the 6th floor in a room with balcony (huge!). Rooms are ok. Breakfast is average. The main problem in this hotel is the staff. They are unfriendly and they have no idea what hospitality is. Too bad for a nice hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel service I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: EM1309
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were advised that the hotel had no room for us and moved us clear across Rome to a hotel in a residential area behind the Vatican in spite of our objections and insistance that we did not wish to be so far out and that it would interfere with our plans. We were assured that all would be fine if we returned the following day. In spite of having checked by telephone before returning, our rooms were not ready when we arrived. The clerk, a woman, was rude and dismissive. The day before we were to leave we booked the advertised hotel limo service to take us to the airport. We arrived in plenty of time and immediately asked the hotel to confirm our booking, they never reported back to us and in spite of returning to reception a number of times, they could not have shown less concern for the lateness of the limo, or our increasing anxiety about getting to the airport. Christina was objectionable in her attitude and did not apologise in spite of our complaining that she was rude and unhelpful. One member of staff attempted to assist us, and did call us a taxi. In the end our limo did not turn up and we took the taxi, 30 minutes late, to the airport. Other guests had problems with water leaks in bedrooms and we found the bathroom was dangerously overcrowded with whiteware. Beds were uncomfortable and the breakfast was average. Most of all, the attitude of two of the staff was beyond comprehension, and the height of bad manners. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and am amazed that Best Western continue to allow this hotel bear their brand. My advice, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: ShonaS66
Reviews.Content: Staff on arrival were very off hand. Not sure if this was because we did this booking through one of the many websites that offers good deals but we certainly got the impression that they were not interested in our custom. On arrival in the room, there was a distinctly strong smell which we could not get to the root of as we were only staying for a couple of nights we decided not to bother complaining. The air conditioning in the room left a lot to be desired and their instruction not to touch the mode button should be totally ignored as by changing that, it made it a lot more comfortable. Do not expect to get any sort of view as you will be hugely disappointed, our room was on level 1 at the back over the kitchen! In fairness the breakfast was very good quality with lots of choice. Really good local restaurant round the corner which was recommnded to us by the hotel - Mama Angela is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Adequate Service”
Reviews.Author: SSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights , 9/14/11- 9/18/11. Being able to get to Roma Termini in 5 minutes is convenient. We asked for and got an iron and a water heater for the room, which was convenient. The quality of breakfast was good compared to other places that we stayed in Italy. The front desk staff were courteous and polite, we didnt have any negative issues with their service. A lingering problem with a slow draining shower was never resolved though.

Reviews.Title: “too bad for service”
Reviews.Author: Stelyn315
Reviews.Content: Nicely placed hotel on the east side of Termini station, the rooms were clean, the bathroom was also good and clean. There is an abundance of small restaurants in the area with good food even though they are generally overpriced when compared to north american standards. We were there 10 days. They breakfast is always the same type of buffet. Does the job. Their automatic coffee machines are CRAP. When they work, the same command never gives you the same coffee or amount of. The biggest downside is the service! NO ONE has a smile on their face! In 10 days we did not see one smile. When you ask something to the front desk, you get the distinct feeling that you are bothering them. Do ask for availability on the 6th floor for the rooms with terrace if available. No extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lamax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 5 minutes away from Termini station (5-6 minutes walk) and Castro Pretorio subway station (2-3 minutes). Service was good, breakfast very solid and rooms were clean. Wi-fi was temporarily not working but if you are just looking for a decent spot close to downtown, this hotel does the trick. We booked it using air miles so it didn't cost us anything. I am happy with this selection. If you arrive earlier, before your room is ready, they will let you leave your bags at their storage room (there are a couple of neat cafe/restaurants nearby where you can relax while your room is getting ready). Our room was not facing the street so we slept extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: s_ramsam
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel principally for reasons of proximity to Roma Termini station. After doing quite a bit of research on the hotels in the area including tripadvisor reviews, we zeroed in on this one. We arrived at Rome from Paris by air and caught the special train to Termini station from the airport. While we had a good stay with a neat room, good breakfast and excellent access to Termini, of all the hotels we stayed in during our tour of Europe this was the only one we had some difficulty in locating. Some precise information regarding reaching the hotel from the end of Termini station for the first time visitor to Rome would save a lot of bother to the traveller pressed for time. This was also the smallest room we stayed in during our Europe trip. Otherwise, our stay for two nights went off comfortably and we had no complaints about the service or facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppit-harvey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our cruise it was booked for me through the travel agent. We took a taxi from the airport (fiumicino) which cost €40 the hotel looked smart,check in was quick and efficient the receptionist printed out times of the trains for me to get to civitavecchia the following morning which was very helpful. The room was fine,clean and absolutely adequate there was even a mini fridge in the room. We had dinner that night at a local place just round the corner on the right of the hotel which did fab pizza and great service. Breakfast at the hotel was really good a nice selection of bread,fruit,cereal etc i really enjoyed it and could have eaten much more than I did,we also had the hot chocolate from the machine. We then took a taxi to termini station for our train which I think was €10 since we were only there for a night I cannot really comment on the location and when I returned to Rome after my cruise I did book into the hotel Lancelot which was near the colosseum but I think the villafranca would be absolutely fine to stay at,the public transport in Rome is very good. The train to civitavecchia cost €4.50 and there was one every hour it took about 1hr 10mins if you are also going on a cruise. In hindsight I probably would have booked a hotel in civitaveccia the night before or even just stayed at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Value and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: For those complaining about the walk from Termini, simply take Metro line B direction Rebibba for one stop to Castro Pretorio and you will be about a short block and a half from the hotel. While the rooms are a bit small, they have everything you need and the breakfast is excellent! If you are too worried about your room you must be missing Rome! As mentioned, the hotel's location relative to a metro station make it an excellent access point to all of central Rome. I have also stayed at BW Art Deco and Sheraton Roma and of the 3, this would be my first choice should i be so lucky to get back.

Reviews.Title: “TAKE THE BUS FROM THE AIRPORT NOT THE TRAIN”
Reviews.Author: earivas2005
Reviews.Content: When you read all the reviews of the hotel, most mention the train that arrives to Roma termini. Don't take it unless you want to walk about half a mile inside the terminal before arriving to the street. On top of that in the train you have to carry your bags with you. Very uncomfortable. Instead take the bus. It's cheaper. You put your luggage inside the baggage compartment of the bus and forget it until you arrive to the bus stop on one side of the train terminal. In fact is in front of another Best Western Hotel, where you can get directions with a map to your hotel. The candies are an extra bonus. Another thing is that inside the train terminal besides being confusing even after going to Rome several times, there is more danger. Pickpockets and even worse we saw a purse snatcher in action. So take the bus and avoid the danger.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, enjoyed stay, staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: Jth1980
Reviews.Content: Location 5 blocks from train station, long walk for most attractions, but ok. Nice helpful staff and were very pleasent. Rooms clean. Breakfast fair. Enjoyed stay. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dr_evil_dad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Villafranca in July 2011. It was for a family vacation. The hotel is situated in a mixed area with lots of small boutique hotels nearby. It is located a block away from the Castro Pretorio Metro station as well as the UNICEF headquarters in Rome. There are many nice restaurants within easy walking distance. The only complaint I would have is that you do get a lot of street noise and some of the rooms don't face the street, some face an interior space shared with adjacent buildings. From time to time you will get the occasional street noise like an Ambulance or passing Carabinari car. There is no Wifi in the hotel and like most European hotels there is cable internet however it's 10 Euro per day. Stazione Termini is also less than 10 minutes away so you can connect from the Airport (FCO) quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “perfect.”
Reviews.Author: cortmalaw
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a short 4 day break and didnt really know what to expect due to some of the "reviews" on here. i have to ask what people are really looking for if they found faults with this place. the location is perfect, just a 5 min walk away from the metro which will connect u to everywhere ur likely to want to go. the hotel itself was spotless, well air conditioned and towels were changed everyday. there was a wide selection to choose from at breakfast too which i was surprised at considering the negative comments about breakfast on here. sausages, bacon, eggs, cereal, fruit, croissants, u name it. the staff were helpful enough. we never had any problems with them at all. there not going to break into a full chat with u but theyll answer ur queries if u have any which is all i would ask. i think SOME people in here need to get a grip. your in rome for god sake, go and enjoy 1 of the most wonderful places in the world instead of trying to pick out the smallest of faults in an immaculate hotel!!!!! for anyone planning on booking here, go for it, its the perfect hotel to stay in. i couldnt have asked for anything more and it was very reasonably priced too. we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Very Clean, Good Breakfast, Good Aircondition”
Reviews.Author: Thats_10
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, about 10 min. of walk from central station of rome. We loved it, It was excelent for our purpose to travel and rest.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: KTezha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Villafranca 6/17-6/21, and had a wonderful experience! I was hesitant at first, due to the negative reviews on tripadvisor, but I was in for a surprise! The hotel is located on a small street, but it's very close to pretty much all of Rome's main attractions (we walked everywhere, but the main trainstation is about 5 blocks away). There were many cute restaurants nearby, and very affordable (I recommend 3 Archi, right across the street). The room we had was great; it had a large bed, a living room area, nice (and very clean!) bathroom, and a private balcony with a table and seats overlooking the city. The lobby/bar area is very nicely sized and decorated. The staff was also great! We mainly dealt with Frederico, who took very good care of us. The only thing I didn't like about this experience was that it was way too short! Thank you Villafranca, for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: suegav
Reviews.Content: On arrival, hotel foyer is quite nice like the pictures on the web but that is really where it stops. Reception staff were not friendly and occasion quite rude even allowing for the roman attitude. The rooms are quite small and the bathroom was tiny. The beds are not very comfortable and we would expect a better standard from a best western. There is no wifi available in the hotel but they do have an Internet connection at reception. Overall we were quite disappointed with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, Clean Room, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: grammy137
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BW Hotel Villafranca 9 Roma only for one night, pre-cruise, Oct. 2010. Small hotel, friendly staff, decent breakfast-buffet included in the price. Our room was clean, but the bed was like sleeping on cement. Senior AARP rate paid 144Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra and stay somewhere else - it's worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Hoser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night. I booked the room for one night using Best Western points. I am at their highest tier of membership, that being Diamond, and always get special treatment as such. This is by far the worst Best Western experience I have ever had, Diamond status or not.... and I obviously stay at a lot of them to reach top tier status. Long and short of it, they wanted to charge 25 Euro more for my wife ON A REWARD NIGHT!!! After 10 minutes of arguing with 2 different people who had obvious language barriers and were adament that that was the policy I told them I would call Best Western International and see for myself if hat was in fact the 'policy'. Minutes later they were apologizing all over themselves and telling us no extra charge whereas we felt that minutes earlier if we didn't pay we would be dumped out on the street! Other than this unfortunate incident the hotel is not that bad. The elevators are the tiniest I've ever been on. They have dark hallways with motion activated lights which come on as you walk down the hall. I understand the need to conserve electricity but the darkness was quite absurd. The room was actually much bigger than I expected and clean. View of another building 30 feet across the street. The location was excellent to Termini and an even nearer subway station. For God sakes, keep a tight grip on your wallet and purse. This is the only place that we saw pick pockets looking for victims and we were in Athens and Cairo as well. You'll have no problems unless you look obvlivious. Unless you are on a budget and don't want to spend more than 100 euros a night or so, do yourself a favor and pick a different hotel. Perhaps an independant that is quaint and is not ranked number 400 plus out of the rated hotels. Staff here were the worst of our 25 day trip across Europe and Egypt. Tolerable for 1 night for a cheap price.....

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel - for the head rather than the heart”
Reviews.Author: wyean
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of the largely favorable reviews we had read on Trip Advisor - and by and large we weren't disappointed. The hotel is conveniently located for Termini station and all of the major sites. Our room was decorated in a fairly anomynous style typical of many corporate hotel chains these days, but was spotlessly clean and well serviced. The bed was generously sized and among the comfiest we have slept on. Our only criticism here is that the air conditioning was on continuously, with no facility to regulate the air flow, thus making the room a little chilly at times. Breakfast can best be described as average; the hot buffet items (i.e. cocktail sausages, scrambled egg, streaky bacon) were not of particularly good quality, so we confined ourselves to the cold buffet, which was somewhat limited in choice. The staff were efficient, although not very friendly, whilst one came across as downright surly. All in all, there is much to recommend this hotel as a convenient base for exploring this beautiful city. However, if you are looking for something quirky,unique or special from your accomodation, then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central offering good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FluffieBunnie
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many hotels, we decided on this one as it offered a competative price and was central to the main train station in Rome (termini). It was a little walk, especially with our cases in tow, but was manageable. It took us about 10/15 minutes. The staff were welcoming, the front lobby very clean and modern. The room was clean, practical and although a little small, was perfect for an overnight stay in a central city location. Breakfast the next day was great with a large selection of cooked and continental. Something could be found for even the fussiest of eaters (children included!). I wasn't disappointed with my choice in hotel. It ticked all the boxes I was looking for, and would easily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ShebaWales
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 40th Anniversary and wanted to go to Rome. We booked another hotel but when we checked the reviews we decided that it had bad reviews and made me quite nervous. We spoke to our travel agent and she suggested the Hotel Villafranca. Reading the reviews we agreed that this would be a better choice and I am sure we could not have chosen better. On arrival at the hotel we immediately relaxed when we saw it was clean and the staff on the reception were lovely. Our room was located on the 6th floor and was beautiful: the ensuite had a bath, which I prefer, as well as the shower for my husband. We had a lovely balcony where we could sit and have a glass of wine to wind down after the day sightseeing. The room had a safe (that was included in the price) and a fridge that we could use to store our water etc. The room was cleaned and the towels changed daily. The toiletries were also replaced daily. The location is good too. We were 10 minute stroll from the station where you could catch a train, bus or tour bus - brilliant. The tour bus costs €20 for a 24hr ticket or €25 for 48hrs: we bought the 24hr ticket at 14.30hrs and we were able to cover everything we wanted to by the following afternoon. We walked miles and climbed hundreds of steps and enjoyed every minute of it. The traffic takes some getting used to especially when you use the crossings, but even that was easy as long as you were vigilant. The Hotel (brilliant) hotel staff (lovely and very friendly). Our holiday in Rome made our 40th Anniversary memorable and we will never forget our wonderful stay in the Hotel Villafranca - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Avg hotel, gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: Anthony31
Reviews.Content: We booked 1 room recently for a sat night thru orbitz. The hotel is located only a 3-4 min walk from the castro pretoria metro or 10-12 min walk from termini station/metro. There are many hotels in the area + some restaurants although we never ate in the area. The staff were friendly overall. We checked luggage when room wasn't ready and came back after 2p. They have a secure room for storing luggage which they tag and give you the other half. Internet isn't free but they will let one person go behind the chk in desk to print boarding passes if you need to. The breakfast room is avg but I would suggest going early at 7 to get a table. There were meats, cheeses, sweets, cereals, fruit + juice / coffee machines. The hotel looks recently renovated as do the rooms. The room and bathroom was spacious. Bath amenities were nice and glad there was a shower curtain since the shower is basically stand alone in corner of room. 2 things were an issue. First, there were hairs on the comforter. I know these generally aren't changed out but it was still gross. Second, the walls are thin. We had to call front desk late at night when the neighbors were too loud. Unfort the front desk didn't understand but thankfully they left out of room 20 min later. Since we were flying out of Rome, this hotel served its purpose and the price was in line with most others in area. I would stay again but only in the short term.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: carolevegas
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay with extended family and 3 year old son. Hotel was ok. Very clean but not 4 star. Bar poor, had to show staff how to use bottle opener and red wine was like vinegar. Breakfast typical continental was ok but tables very cramped, clearly trying to fit too many in. Also some people ended up eating in bar from low tables. Staff ok. We had a triple room which was a good size but bathroom tiny with small gap between toilet and bidet for entry to bath/shower. If you request tea/coffee making you may be lucky but kettles in short supply so may disappear the next day. Whoever shouts loudest gets one of the few kettles. One of our party resorted to hiding his each morning so that it didn't disappear! Can't help thinking it got 4 stars so would incur highest tourist tax.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but No Frills”
Reviews.Author: eighthwonder
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I researched hotels in Rome we found that all were really expensive, especially if you wanted to be able to walk everywhere, so this hotel was a good compromise for us to stay in a good location in Rome but also save some money. Next time I would spend a little more and upgrade on the hotel. This hotel was clean and the breakfast was actually pretty good by hotel standards, with many choices of meats, eggs, fruits, breads and pastries, and coffee, tea and juices, but the front desk staff always seemed annoyed and bothered when we had questions and didn't offer any helpful info on their own. The hotel was clean and very close to public transportation, but were also able to walk to major sites and back, though we are walkers and it might be too far of a walk for someone who is not in decent shape or who has health issues. The room that we had was adequate and clean, but certainly had no-frills and was of three star quality. The neighborhood that the hotel was in seemed a little dirty and made me nervous at night, but we did not see or hear of any crime in the area. If you are looking for a basic room and shower that is close to the major sites in Rome or are a business traveler who doesn't need to be pampered, then this hotel would be great for you. If you want to stay some place romantic or are looking for any extra comforts, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Business only”
Reviews.Author: BJSMumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average. The staff is not very welcoming when compared to the other hotels during our Italy tour. no fuss no frills no chat. The rooms are decent but very small and feels too cramped. The acs with heaters have replaced the normal heaters which still remain in the room and bathroom as a showpiece. The bathroom hence now feels cold during winters. The hotel now needs renovation as there are visible repairs needed on equipments.

Reviews.Title: “Still some way to go to deserve that fourth star”
Reviews.Author: soultraveller76
Reviews.Content: Overall a quite nice hotel, although didn't see anything really remarkable. Upon arrival we were a little taken aback by the fact that the hotel was obviously undergoing renovation - or at least some kind of maintenance. This would not be a problem, we understand that this kind of interventions are ciclically needed, and normally would not complain about this. But it did not seem equally right that the lobby, stairs, and corridors had not been cleaned after the workers had left that day, nor did they get cleaned until the following day. As far as we know, until recently the hotel used to be a three star (a giveaway is that on some websites it is still referred to as such) and they are obvously working to make it a four star. Fair enough. But some points will have to be worked on a little harder. The room was fairly clean and tidy upon arrival, but not as much the next day. For instance, we had requested tea and coffee making facilities in the room (which took a while to be obtained, but nevermind) and the next day when we returned we found that the set was exactly as we had left it, with dirty cups and a half a jug of milk that at that time of the day smelled sour (by the way, we would have put it in the minibar to be used on our second night had the minibar been working...). The heating in the room was not working 100%, but we managed to obtain a reasonable temperature. We were not as lucky in the bathroom, which had no heating element, at least that we could see. And if there was and we did not see it, then it didn't work. Didn't like the automatic vending machines on the floors (rather pricey too), it reminded us of the youth hostels we used to sleep in years ago. Breakfast was ok, decent but little varied. The room is however raher small and tends to get crowded. The staff is polite enough but not outstanding. The situation is good, Termini is within a resonable walking distance, and most sites can be reached with either the metro or one of the many bus lines stopping there. Price was quite adequate. Overall a positive experience, but not an unforgettable one. Lots of room for improvement. I could recommend it, but not without reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: izzyny
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from 10 days at Best Western Villafranca in Rome. The staff is great, very helpful and friendly. They spoke english very well and where willing to help us as we did not speak italian at all. The rooms are neat and clean if a little small. The street gets noisey at night, welcome to Rome! Breakfast is quite nice, eggs, toast, pastries, fruit and coffee - what more do you want! The location is ideal. A block from the metro and a short walk from Termini station makes this a perfect place to stay in Roma. This is a nice little hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Wadd79
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to family and friends. I think it offers great value for money in a good location for getting to the tourist attractions. The rooms are a little on the small side but we spent most of our time out, so it didn't cause us a problem. There was lots of choice at breakfast and service was fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “The service here was terrible”
Reviews.Author: Ronniec78
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here at the end of September and I was not pleased with this place at all. First off, the location of this place isn't as bad as a lot of people say it is. It's true the area isn't attractive but I didn't see any druggies or bums in the area at night and felt very safe walking around. There are some good restaurants within walking distance which was nice. The hotel itself is not attractive. The rooms are very small and the hotel is very basic which is expected at a Best Western. The worst thing about this place was the front desk. There was a stocky guy with dark hair and a light beard and mustache who was a complete jerk. We would ask for a cab while he was on his cell phone so he put down his phone did something on the computer and walked into the backroom to continue his conversation without saying a word. This guy needs to go. The young girl with the glasses wasn't as bad but was still a very poor employee. You definitely get what you pay for with this place. Another downer was the breakfast in the morning. Everything was cold and the breakfast was just not appealing. Needless to say, my stay in Rome was not a good one and I would never return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxB01
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at during a tour of Italy. We were pretty disappointed that the first staff member we encountered checking in was quite rude. Luckily that was the only time we saw him, and the rest of the staff was fairly nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable, although the beds were kind of hard. Nice bathroom. We stayed on the street side and found it a bit noisy thanks to the bar next door. The breakfast was decent. Good location fairly close to Termini - although not as close as we were led to think.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: bargainhunter_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights. and found room very comfortable - loved giant size bed and huge balcony on 6th floor even had 2 deckchairs as well as table & chairs. Able to relax here after sight seeing. Very spacious bathroom - all well cleaned, Remember to ask for Welcome Tray for room. Close to Metro and Termini Lots of good, reasonable rest.aurants round about (In particular Mama Angelas) (go right right and right again out of hotel ) Good supermarket very close. Also Oasis Bar sells good cheap carry out burgers. Ordered room service for breakfast on 2nd day as no egg left and very busy on our 1st visit to restaurant on previous day. It didn't arrive so had to phone - still had to wait and we were very disappointed to receive a very sparse breakfast- no hot food but forks & knives? and mainly cakes. After that experience went to restaurant for breakfast and was quieter and plenty food to chose from. Reception staff very helpful. Best to hail taxi in street as cheaper than hotel ordering (specially to airport - 30 euros as opposed to 48) No particular facilities in hotel but for the price we paid and having the balcony facility - overall would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: alicelam2004
Reviews.Content: For the price that I paid, this hotel is pretty good value. It took me a while to find it thought. The room is nice and good size in Rome. Bathroom is good size. There is also a balcony in my room too. Just that it is not very closed to the Rome Termini.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Rosiejj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Villafranca in August. The location was superb: only 5-10 min walk from Termini (about 5 blocks away) and less than 5 mins from another small Metro station. Quiet at night and the free air conditioning was a godsend. Buffet breakfast was adequate - bread, cakes, fruit, cereals, tea coffee juice & the usual amusing effort at a full english breakfast! However it was only open 7-10am so had to make an effort to get up to catch it. Very clean room, big comfortable bed, clean bathroom, sheets & towels changed daily which was a nice surprise. Polite staff & a secure luggage room for check out day. I'm quite fussy about cleanliness & I would definitely visit again - it was near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: laloos_10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel for 5 days. The location is excellent: Metro station is just a block away and if you want to go by foot: it's about a 30 minute walk from Rome's major sightseeing spots. There's a food store nearby as well. One thing we didn't like was the breakfast: it was absolutely the same food every morning (good food, but all the same). Overall, good value for your money if you are not looking for anything luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Rethink this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilovepie89
Reviews.Content: I had to make another reservation as my first hotel no longer had available rooms at the price I intially got them for and I found this hotel via internet. I thought, since it was a Best Western, that it may be a good hotel for myself and my daughter. The price was good (adequate) and the reviews seemed ok. The first thing I will say about this hotel is that when the taxi driver dropped us off, I had second thoughts. The hotel facade is tiny, the lobby dark and small. The desk clerk was in the middle of doing something and did not seem happy to stop for us. This hotel, however, did have vending machines and ice available (what you would expect in the USA) and was able to assist with a last minute tour booking. The breakfast was good but you have to hope you can get a seat. Internet is 10 euros/day. The restaurant outside (Oasies Pub Birreria) is very nice and cheap and we had a good meal. However, at night, this hotel is VERY noisy and we did not sleep well at all. The room is tiny (we practically crawled over each other) and the bathroom is even smaller (if you drop the soap in the shower you probably could not bend down to pick it up unless you were skinny).Perhaps if you are traveling with another adult, on a strict budget and do not mind the closeness of the other hotels across the street and the visible garbage this may be the place for you. It is close to the city center but the train is a good 15 min walk. Price matters - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for termini and eating out”
Reviews.Author: tok59
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Villafranca on 19thJuly for 1 week and i have to say i was surprised by yhe location and the handyness of its position . The hotel is excellent for the price and the buffy breakfast isa great in the morning .There are plenty of eating establishments about but be carefull some over charge for the service . Take the tourbus if its your first time as this gives you some idea as to where places are . I would definetly go back to the Villafranca Tom& Anne Belfast N Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusannahB
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my daughter. This was a nice but not fancy hotel in a quiet street conveniently near to a metro (subway) station. The front desk staff were not particularly friendly or helpful, but they answered our queries. The room was large but minimalistic and the beds and pillows were hard, but after the first night we didn't notice anymore. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, not the best place but conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: anilutta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance from Roma Termini (the mail railway station). Its a very commercialized hotel as you would expect a best western to be. Nothing extra-ordinary about the hotel but nevertheless if you are looking for a decent, clean place which is centrally located its not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!! I loved Rome and this hotel make my stayed very comfortable..”
Reviews.Author: gabyalvarez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the best western villafranca for 4 days, it was my 1st visit to Rome :) I was looking for a well located hotel, cause I was planning to do what every tourist does.. Walk a lot! Its location was perfect! The staff speaked english and some of them Spanish (im from latin america), they helped me with a map and told me how to get to the places I wanted.. The hotel reception is very nice, the rooms are not that big, but big enough for a couple.. Very comfortable.. I didnt have noise problems at all... The bathroon was neat! And i had a balcony!!! Very well paid for a 4 stars hotel.. My rate was about 170 dolars the night.. At the exchange rate of may. You can get it cheaper now. The brakfast was complety.. You can find here eggs, bacon, jam, different kind of cheese and breads, yogurt, cereal, juices.... Etc etc... Very complete to begin a whole day journey like i did.. From the airport I just spent 14 euros on the Leonardo da Vinci express and get off right in Termini station.. I walked with my luggage to the hoten, so in movilization you will save a lot of money for sure! To get to almost all the turistic places you need to walk, Rome is not a big city, in fact all the sights are very near from each other.. I went to almost every place walking... And thats the best way to get to know a nice city like Rome.. If you get tired, use the metro, its very easy to use, there are only 2 lines and very easy to get to termini at the end of the day.. (By metro or bus either way its VERY EASY to go to termini) Ive never write review of anythig, but trip advisor was very usefull for me to decide which hotel to choose.. And this one was perfect!! I would return here for sure (if my wish to the di trevi fountain comes true) ..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kocuuur
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for an entire weekend (2 couples). Receptionist were really friendly and welcoming and we didn't have any kind of problem. I'd suggest this hotel because of its great position (50 mt from metro stop and 5 min walk from Termini). Rooms are clean and pretty nice. Only thing missing is Wi-Fi...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villafranca - Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: MikLat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located outside of the Termini train station. A great spot for travelers who plan on walking a lot. Walking to Termini is not a problem, you will pass many good restaurants and the street is very well lit. The staff was cold but did answered our questions right away. Our room was very standard but was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “quick stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: GBHTaranto
Reviews.Content: I am a wheelchair user. I stayed with another guy in a wheelchair for three days in Rome. We found a hotel on last minute.com. The Best Western Villafranca was convenient located near the train station and near bus stops. The staff were excellent. The room was small for two wheelchairs but did the job. The bathroom was accessible and the hotel supplied a plastic shower chair. The best part of our stay was the breakfast. You had a selection of hot and cold of food and there was plenty of it. This was included in the 70euro per night deal. Very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we were satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: leetoonastic
Reviews.Content: pretty good location, 3 min walk to the metro station, 10 min walk to central station. ok breakfast, comfortable bed

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says on the tin BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirepudding007
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the "hotel" mid afternoon, thinking we had walked into the wrong place. However; this turned out to be the reception area. It turned out the hotel was having extensive renovation works done to it. We WERE NOT told anything about this by thomson, the hotel or great best western. The website did not say anything about the lack of a proper reception, no bar and lounge area - which was one of the main reasons why we had chosen the hotel, so that we could relax and put our feet up after hours of walking around rome. We also found out that you had to go and collect a ticket for breakfast and walk half way up the street, i kidd you not, to the breakfast room which was in a small, but i have to say a nicely done out place, understaffed and cramped area. There was often a queue for breakfast and the dishes where the hot food was kept were often empty, due to their very small size. The rooms were nicely furnished but extremely chlostrophobic even for a city hotel. The bed was quite stiff and the air con made a constant irritating noise and was poised in such a position that it had no benefit to cooling the cramped room down. The bathroom was adequate, no bath, but a small shower which gave you no room atall to move around in. You had to step out of the shower in order to rub shampoo into your head, meanwhile the water temperature was temperamental. I was disgusted to find that when i opened the curtains, the shutters and the windows to find that the back of our room looked down onto what resembled a shanty town come barbeque area, with washing hung from old rusty railings. The staff in reception were fairly helpful but lacked the usual italian charm and humour. Overall i was thoroughly disappointed by the hotel. Oh beware the hotel is in a bit of a dodgy area, littered with drunked tramps, one even tried to wander into "reception" and beggers on mass.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service - Would never stay again!”
Reviews.Author: NZ09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice - once for a stopover and the second time for four nights. We were very unhappy with both experiences. The hotel staff at reception were rude and very unhelpful. The bed for our first night was terrible - it was lumpy and uneven (and very small). The shower heat was uneven (either warm or cold - never hot). We stayed in four other hotels during our Europe holiday and this was by far the worst (in fact the worst hotel I've ever stayed in).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: WanderingCanadian33
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Rome is the best bang for your buck going. If you like to walk it is within a long walking distance of the downtown sites. It is located right off a subway line, 1 block. It was by far the best value I found for Rome. The rooms were so clean, nice and modern. The breakfast was amazing and there was a really large food selection.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Khalid_Nadeem
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights with my wife and experience was not good. May be because I have been staying in marriotte and other good hotels. But if you get a deal very cheap and you do not bother about the room and tidyness and there is no harm in staying there. We had problem with bath tub and promised by the receptionest many times but no action taken.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, uncomfortable bed, luke warm showers”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: Steer clear of the 3 night stay special offer. They are renovating, so the deal is on. The rooms are the size of a toilet, and the bed is uncomfortable. Then again its a bed to collapse in after a long day, but the luke warm showers were dissapointing. The location is good, its away from the husstle and bustle, and the best surprize was the free breakfast, which made up for the poor quality of the room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: SorrentoQueen
Reviews.Content: Absolute crap....spoiled my entire Roman experience!!! Never again....wouldn't even rate it a one star!

Reviews.Title: “No frills to say the least”
Reviews.Author: Britannic
Reviews.Content: Not a bad location quite close to the station. First room we were given had no safe so Hotel gave us an upgrade to a much nicer room with little fuss. Friendly enough staff,spoke good English and arranged Opera tickets for us. In my opinion Rome is a City with two sides,History rich with great culture, but struggles when striking a balance with its insane traffic,swarthy taxi drivers and visible criminal element...be on your guard 24/7!

Reviews.Title: “See the Boot on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: CityTraveler77
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness and comfort of the Villafranca were wonderful to come back to after busy and often exhausting days of sightseeing in Rome.The rooms are certainly "European" (re: small), yet very clean (cleaned each day of our stay and equipped w/bath and spa toiletries) and quiet.The location of the hotel, however, was a blessing and a curse--It is not centrally located near any main tourist attractions...yet that made it very quiet and safe.I would definitely recommend this to 1st time travelers to Italy still...but especially to those who have experienced the tourist attractions already and are looking for a peaceful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cold showers and poor breakfast!! - wouldn't stay here ever again!!”
Reviews.Author: cute_zizzi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. Whilst it's location is good (just 5 mins walk from Metro), my bf and I were less than impressed with everything else. Shower was unpredictable - sometimes lukewarm, sometimes freezing, but never hot; beds are hard making it uncomfortable to sleep; elevator is extremely tiny and slow; and the breakfast was poor - tinned fruit, no fresh juice, tea/coffee machine not working. Breakfast room itself is small, and gets overcroweded quickly. Service also wasn't great - luggage stored in a tin garage next door for you to collect yourself; and reception only have travel adapters that will fit into UK sockets?!!! Definitely would not stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adament_traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice but very small in all aspects. Its located fairly close to the central train station in Rome and easy to get to all major city attractions. We stayed there for a long weekend and found it quite pleasant. Checking in/out takes a long time as they only have one receptionist. The rooms are clean but also very tiny, bathrooms seem to have more towels then places to hang them on. Breakfast was quite limited in option and we just had cereal. There is underground station very near by which makes it easy to get around. The Hotel is self is located in a street which you wouldn’t want to walk down alone on dark but other than that its perfectly fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Out-of-the-way but quiet”
Reviews.Author: owly11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not centrally located. It is quiet and on small side street. Room was small. Breakfast was very good. Luggage that was stored due to early arrival was not brough up by staff and had to be retrieved from locked room outside of hotel by traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location for touring around”
Reviews.Author: EricMonica
Reviews.Content: We found the Villafranca Hotel to be excellent value. It was clean, nice adequate size rooms and the reception staff more than helpful. The self-service buffet breakfast was very good with a good choice of food to choose from. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from Station Termini, which we used frequently, with the Underground Metro station also inside. Buy a 2 or 3 day ticket for the Metro, you can use either red or blue lines and hop on or off as many times as you like, you will get to nearly all of the main attractions, including Vatican City. Would recommend the 110 open top bus on your first day, we found it very helpful in getting our bearings around this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: aussietravelers26
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at this little gem and was an absolute bargin. We figured booking a motel in Rome over christmas would be difficult and pricey but when we found this place for only ~650 euros for 9 nights we were wrapt. It is a typical Best Western 3star motel, with nice clean, simple rooms, ours of reasonable size but not huge. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the location was good, close to termini and supermarkets etc. and had decent buffet breakfast spread which was great to energise for the day. The best thing was the price, at approx 72 euros per night, it was an absolute bargin

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: D8andS7
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to some of the main attractions of Rome also close to two supermarkets. The rooms had a nice decor and the ensuite was clean. You could get internet on your tv at a minimal cost which was great. Breakfast was included and had quite a selection. A good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: ingemare
Reviews.Content: We came down from Milan to visit some friends who live in Rome. We just needed a nice clean place to stay that was near Termini (the main train station) so we could get around the city easily. We also met up with some other friends here, so they stayed here too. Reception booked us in quickly and easily. They gave us a little key card and a little key. We all went to the elevators to go up to our rooms. Well.... first we had to wait for the guy who was using both elevators to unload what looked like all the linen in the hotel as well as what appeared to be all the garbage as well. Very slowly. Finally, he finished unloading enough that we were able to push the garbage bags aside and get into the elevator. The hallways on each floor were the same: carpet that had been vacuumed, but was still dirty. Molding that was new, but falling off. Paint that wasn't old, but no scratches were covered up, so it looks, well, just kind of cheap. The hallways are DARK. Little motion detectors set off the hallway lights while you walk down them. OK, that's weird, but I'm ok with it. We got in the room and it was dark.... and none of the lights worked. Luckily, the maid was out in the hall and explained that we had to stick this little key into this hole in the wall to enable all the lights. (Gee, that would have been nice to know ahead of time) Once we got in, the room was nice and clean. I had read on one of the reviews here that the beds were hard. (which I like). Wow, they sure weren't kidding!. Oddly, they weren't evenly hard... Oooohhh, it was because we actually were on two twin beds that were pushed together and held there with the sheets. Nice. I work over the internet, so the first thing I did was to pop that network cable in and check my.... oops, no connection. I read the little instructions, "turn on the TV and choose internet", ok, I can do that.... oops... I can't. Power doesn't do anything. After pounding on the remote for a while I get about 10 TV channels, but nothing else. Pretty soon I called the front desk and was told I needed a code. So, I paid 10 euro and got a few letters and a number to enter.... somewhere, they just kept telling me it will be "right there". OK, it wasn't. After about 20 minutes I finally had them send someone up. About 30 minutes later he arrived - and couldn't fix it. He finally said, I'll be back in 2 minutes. It wasn't until I told the receptionist to make me a reservation at a different hotel and that I wasn't paying for current day that I actually got service. Suddenly the, "I'm sorry sir, but I've called the main office in Milan and only got a busy signal - it's not my fault", changed to "Here's a key to a new room with Internet that works." total of 3 hours of begging. Other than that: the shower head kept falling off on me, but the pressure was great. The bright lights wouldn't turn off in our entry-way... annoying. The temperature in our room was great, but my friends had to move because their heater was stuck on. (Oh, and the water coming from their faucet suddenly turned brown. Nice) All in all: Location: decent Cleanliness: decent Responsiveness: decent The brown water thing was kind of gross. The internet thing was extremely annoying. The twin beds pushed together (in our new room I had to do it myself!) odd. I'd never recommend it. There are about 100 hotels in the area, find a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trasa8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. Cost 420 euro including buffet breakfast which is available from 7 - 10 a.m...great food and lovely range of coffee/teas...orange juice is awful though! For Irish guests reading this, the sausages at breakfast are the german variety and not the galtee type!! and the egg is hot but more like a scrambled omlette..also cake and pastries a little odd at 7a.m but as they say " when in Rome" .....so go ahead and eat them...delicious.... Asked for room with terrace when I booked with Booking.com and was given one on arrival. Room was on 6th floor, quiet street below..Check in was fast and smooth. When guests asked advice on excursions/restaurants etc they got the information from staff at front desk. Lots of maps and leaflets lying around anyway. Hotel is more like a B&B. It is old in places if you take the time to look around , but too much to see and do in Rome to be concerned as to the appearance of the paintwork!! We ate breakfast at 7 a.m and left hotel each day at 8.30 a.m we returned at 1a.m each morning!!!! so not much time spent there. Hotel is a few streets from Termini Station so very handy for the Ryanair Terravision bus to and from the airport. Didn't find the area near Termini to be dangerous at night and it is very busy with tourists throughout the day. Plenty of police about anyway. Hotel room had bath and shower , the room was cleaned each day, sheets changed and toiletries replaced. Bath was fab for a soak after long day walking about. Hot water was always available and shower was great. Room had mini bar...we didn't like that , as it was open when we arrived and two or four items missing, we went down and got reception to make a note of it. It was bothering us the whole stay that we would be charged for stuff we didn't take, so make a check when you arrive and sort it out with staff. Air conditioner was noisey and when we rang down to reception at 1.30.am to ask them to switch it off and they did right away. The old man on night reception is gruff and moody ,but that is just his personality, depends on how you approach him I guess. He got us a kettle and teabags (couldn't find any milk!) at 1.30 a.m when we came in from walking around and we had nice cup of tea before sleeping!!! So he not bad in the end!! In the room service book it says service available 24 hours a day , but not so, kitchen and bar close at 11.30/midnight. A good mix of ages and nationalities staying at hotel. Taxi can be called from front desk and is 8 to 10 euro to get to Trevi Fountain or Piazza Navona...we did this on one evening when it was pouring rain..... We walked the hotel stairs one day just to see the other corridors and yes, I think they were renovated, new doors ,carpets etc,, Overall well worth the money for what we got,basic ,clean and did the job.. I would not have been happy to pay anymore than we did. Reception staff in daytime may need a course on customer relations and be a little more welcoming and chatty. Breakfast staff could teach them a thing or two as they were excellent, particularly the young lad with spiky gelled hair...so nice!! Do stay at this hotel , it's not bad at all!!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good base for weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mistress_Yorkie
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Villafranca for 3 nights - we used the Terravision bus to get from Ciampino to Termini and the hotel is about 5mins walk from the train station. Hotel is clean and efficient. Bedrooms aren't enormous but plenty of storage space and how much stuff do you take for a weekend away? Bathroom clean and modern, complete with good size power-shower which was a bonus. Location is OK, everything bar the Vatican City is walkable from the hotel, although nothing is exactly close by (Colosseum was about a half hour walk, same for Spanish Steps etc in other direction) - but then with easy access to both Metro lines, which we found very efficient the couple of times we used them, if you don't fancy a long walk in the heat there's no problem getting places. I have no complaints about the hotel whatsoever (didn't even experience the runny eggs at breakfast a few people have mentioned lol!), however it was a little out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet people !!”
Reviews.Author: travelerss38
Reviews.Content: I was not completely satisfied with the hotel location because it's too close to the train station where lots of people hovering around and a bit far from all the attractions. But the good thing is that couple of restaurants in the neighborhood are pretty good. The room was not fancy but clean, I would say the price is fair with this rating in Rome.
