People there were very nice, they even prepared the breakfast basket to go for us due to our 'way' early flight schedule. That's very sweet !!

Reviews.Title: “This spot served all our needs and more.”
Reviews.Author: Roquemama
Reviews.Content: After checking this site many times before our trip I was unsure what to expect, however we were very happy with the hotel location, room size, and breakfast. It is located in a very convenient area that is only a block from the one metro line, and about a 5-10 minute walk to the major Termini station. The hotel was very clean, the room was not small by any means, there was a nice full bathroom complete with a bidet. The TV was average sized and has broadcasts in English, French, German, and Italian. Some of the staff were very helpful when asked about local sites, some were not as friendly but I wouldn't say they hindered our good time in the least. The breakfast offered more options than many hotels. They offered eggs(yes a bit runny) ham and weiners, pastries, cereals, breads, yogurts, cookies, all sorts of coffee drinks, cocoa, and juice. There are also many great little eateries in the area that are affordable. Close to a grocery market and since it is so close to the Castro Pretorio metro the major sites like the Colosseum and forum are only 10-20 minutes from your door to the sites. We spoke to others staying at the hotel who had trasfered from elsewhere in Rome and they also commented about how convenient the location is. We were in room 605 and there was even a small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: S3maxx
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel, friendly and helpful staffs especially filipino staff -Coy. Clean and nice room. Air conditioning is good and individually controlled. Towel change daily. plenty to choose from breakfast buffet. location is fine. Good location as it is just one stop from the termini station. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Toilet”
Reviews.Author: jamlaw
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worst flea bag hotel that I have stayed in. I was on the first floor with a view of the roof litterred with cigarette butts, garabage and bird feathers. The rug on the floor defined the word "worn". The drapes stunk, and the bed was, as ACDC would say, "Hard As A Rock".

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but a little far”
Reviews.Author: PSUgal6
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Villafranca for 4 nights in March. It was clean, spacious, and a great value. Okay so it wasn't right next door to any of the attractions, and that was probably it's main drawback. We found ourselves far away from the hotel every night with a long walk back. But the accommodations were good. The included breakfast was fabulous and the front desk staff was reasonably helpful. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel and don't mind a little walk, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Chearful”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Cowley
Reviews.Content: Stayed 18th to 22nd June 2007. The hotel is situated on a quiet street 10 minutes walk from the Termini station. The Villafranca is clean, air-conditioned and provides everything needed for a cheap few nights stay. There are also plenty of cafes and restaurants in the adjoining streets if you are too tired to venture out far for dinner. If you are planning to see the sights, then use the bus or tram services as the Roman roads may be straight, but they are also hard on the feet. It seems that every bus service runs from the station, which is on your doorstep. The only negative about the hotel is that, like much of Rome, it could do with a splash of fresh paint.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price”
Reviews.Author: mcklein
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Villafranca on June. Great treatment, room well cleaned. The Hotel staff is very helpfull. I organize with them a short tour of the eternal city in few minutes....fantastic!!!! Breakfast was super, my son was very happy to find "nesquik chocolate" inside a big Rabbit Gadget. I also find Nesquik cream (it's like nutella) never seen before. What else... thank you for everything. Francis, Lisa and Robert

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: ffeeeeeeee
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us and I was a little worried about going after reading some of the reviews on here, but it turned out just fine. As soon as I walked it I noticed how modern and clean the reception was and the staff were very polite and gave us no hassle. In my opinion it could have been a 4* and I could have paid more and still been satisfied with the level of service. Our room was big and newly renovated with a very comfy bed! Everything was spotlessly clean, too. I admit breakfast was a little hectic, with the occassional fight for the last plate, but the staff were helpful and soon brought new ones out. Overall, I found it to be a great little hotel in a nice area that gave us just what we wanted for a reasonable price - and I can't imagine that happens too often in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Wretched hole of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickenygoodness
Reviews.Content: This place was LOUSY. The halls reek of garbage and cigar smoke. The bed was rock hard. The main concierge is one of those I-despise-tourists-yet-I like-tourist-euros types. I was dreaded every time I had to ask for the key to my room. He was quite nasty as was the other concierge I encountered at check out who billed me for three phone calls I DID not make. He seemed such a mean hostile person that rather than quibble I just paid the bill so I could get the heck out of the nightmare place. It was the most discourteous hotel I have EVER encountered. Do not stay here!!!! It is pretty far from the places you want to go like the Forum, the Vatican, etc. Better to find a hotel within walking distance from them. Avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “You call that a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: tonyhawk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from a trip to Rome. Overall, the trip went fine until we were about to check out from this filthy hotel at 7am. I had a similar experience with the person who reviewed this hotel before me. The staff was still sleeping on a couch in front of the bar. As we approached the front desk, which is located nearby the bar, this staff got up, but his appearance seemed to me of a person who just got up from falling asleep drunk in front of the bar. Not realizing he was the staff, I rang the bell at the front desk, and the guy gave me this cruel look and yelled something at me I couldn't understand, but was pretty sure it meant something mean. That's when I realized he was the staff. He then gave me a piece of paper and said nothing. I had to ask him whether I was all set and he said yes. That was it and he didn't even say goodbye. What a great way to leave a strong impression of the city. All along, I had the feeling that the staff wanted me to feel guilty of waking him up. I would've had a better impression of Rome if I'd just left the keys on the front desk and left silently. The room I stayed in had a small bedroom and a bathroom as big as that bedroom. So they located the closet inside the bathroom. The towels didn't smell clean, there was no shower curtain and the hair dryer attached to the wall was totally busted. Before I came to Rome, I visited Paris and stayed at a hotel that was even smaller, but the staff there were quite friendly and humorous, which made our stay much more pleasant than at Rome. I didn't really expect much from such a cheap hotel, but at the time when I was choosing a hotel before my travel, I thought Best Western, having at least a brand name would've at least trained their staff to be a bit courteous. I guess they didn't. They must've been following the idiom, "When in Rome, do as the Romans do."

Reviews.Title: “Death would be better”
Reviews.Author: Jamgard
Reviews.Content: This is the worse Hotel I have ever stayed at. The room had the fresh smell of sewer. The carpet was filthy. The towels were used. The window opened up to the great view of the small roof 3 feet away from our window. With Rome's finiest trash thrown about it. The staff were rude beyond belief. When we checked out at 5:30am the clerk had made himself a bed on the two chairs in the lobby with the lights out. Nice, Real spookie. When we told him we would like to check out. He gave a look that did not implie. Sure, glad to help you. It was a look of something else. The scam he tried then. was you owe 17 euro for the phone that you used in your room. Told him we called noone as we knew noone in rome. He said you pay it or what you going too do?. I said let me see the Time an date on that phone call. He said I can not give you that. You have to pay. I said. Call the police. cause I am not paying for something I do not see. He then said " Fine" an he tore up the bill. I do not Trust this hotel. we tried to get another room. No more rooms. What you going to do?? We had flowers in the room that our tour guide gave us. Thank God. That masked the smell of death coming from within the room. You would have a better night sleeping on a bench in the bus station then staying at this Hotel from Hell. Anything would be better. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone. Well maybe the Taliban. Stay Away from this really ... really Bad Hotel. Until they get there act together or Best Western steps in an investgates this Hotel. Look elsewhere..

Reviews.Title: “great little 3*”
Reviews.Author: happyhb
Reviews.Content: Got back from Rome last week. This is a nice, clean, polite hotel near the termini station. We got abit lost finding the hotel so I am going to try to give you some clear instructions now - leave the termini station through the via marsala exit. this will bring you out nearly opposite via vincenza (has a church on the corner of the street). walk almost all the way down via vincenza and via villafanca is the last street on the left. It is also ideally situated for the metro - which you dont need to use but it does save abit of time and is a life saver after walking around the sights all day!! The local metro stop is called castro preterio and is only 2 minutes walk from the hotel. and it only costs 1 euro for a trip lasting up to 75 minutes. (same price for bus) The hotel itself we found to be well run. Breakfast is from 7-10am and there is a selection of hot food like bacon and scrambled egg. There was also cereal, pastries and fruit. to drink there was tea, coffee, fruit juice and water. We normally had breakfast at 730 - 8 and it was often quite busy. I also made use of the bar for a couple of quiet drinks. Barman is very helpful and will try to accomadate you even if he doesnt quite understand your choice of drink. Be patient if there is no one behind the bar as this same person also takes the room service to the rooms and will be back at the bar in a couple of minutes. Our room was of average size - though the bathroom was very small. Safe was included. We didnt make use of the minibar so cannot comment on the prices. We did use the tv to watch a movie though. We thought this was quite expensive at 10euros but our feet were too tired to take us anywhere!!!! There are quite alot of restaruants along via vincenza. i would recomend one just a couple of minutes walk away. But it didnt appear to have a name! The signs outside said american breakfast. do not be put off by its look. these serve very nice food and at a very good price. If i ever went back to Rome i would stay at hotel villafranca again

Reviews.Title: “Three Cheers For The Underdog!”
Reviews.Author: RootBoySlim-DC
Reviews.Content: What can I say about his hotel but WOW! This place was so great that I created a trip advisor account and this is my first review of any hotel (and I travel quite a lot). When I was researching hotels in Rome, I did not expect to find such an inexpensive gem. My stay of 4 days was so great that I when I arrived to my ‘upgraded’ hotel by the Coliseum a few days later, I was disappointed by comparison. I stayed during the last week of 2006. First the pros… It was walking distance from Termini Station, but my wife did not know that at the time. We took a taxi from the stand, NOT the guys who ask you if you need a taxi (Note: After arriving, we asked the front desk the average cost for a taxi – they said should not be more than 15 Euro). Upon arriving, the staff was friendly and inviting. As we opened the room door, we were impressed to find that the room was recently renovated. Albeit a small room, it did not feel like it. In fact, it felt like quite the opposite. Our room also had a large in room safe and access to the mini bar. Rather than use the items in the mini-bar, we went to the local supermarkets (PAM and Supermarketini) – both are only a few steps away from the hotel. Why pay 2.30 for a coke when you can purchase a six pack for the same price? Bonus: Breakfast is included with the hotel. If you’ve been to Europe, you’re probably aware that you could easily spend up to 10 Euro for your first morning meal. It was delightful to have the same items offered at no cost. The breakfast is you typical eggs, ham, cheese, breads, cereals and morning drinks. Now the cons… Only one key was available for the room. If you need to leave the room, you turn off all power to the room. If you are in the room, there is a little light outside each room to indicate that you are inside. Although we left the ‘do not disturb’ on the door, our room was cleaned because the light was out. The only internet access is available via dialup. This was not a big problem because there are several internet access terminals near the hotel that will allow you to utilize there computers for 2 Euro per hour. There is not an ice maker in the hotel, but the bartender will provide you some at no cost. Summary: We fell in love with this place and would go back in a New York minute. The new radiators keep the place warm and cozy. A taxi from the Spanish Steps to the hotel was only 10 Euro at night. In my future visits, I will stay here and take a taxi home if I happen to stay outdoors longer than the local buses/subways will allow.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horribel”
Reviews.Author: sljb
Reviews.Content: As I plan our second trip to Europe, I realized that I had never reviewed this hotel. This was something I definitely meant to do as I was staying there. Based on the other reviews posted, experiences at this hotel must depend on which room or floor you stay on. I read what other people have written and I can't believe it is the same hotel as the one I stayed in. Here are just a few of my complaints: 1. Extremely dinghy room - even though the room was somewhat clean, it felt very dirty. 2. The door locked with a little latch that was about to fall off. 3 Garbage in the hallways 4. Wall paper peeling off the walls, big water spots near the radiator (I think it was a radiator) and several other mildew spots on the walls and floors 5. No shower curtain. The floor became soaked when we showered. 6. Very little light - which made this dinghy room even more depressing. I have several photos on another computer and will try to post those later. When we asked to move to another room (thinking it could not be any worse), we were told that they could acommodate us after 12:00. I told them we were going to go sightseeing and asked if we could move when we returned. They stated that it would be fine. When we returned to the hotel, they told us that since we were not availabe to speak with them at 12:00, they would not move us. So much for customer service. At best, before checking in to this hotel, I would ask to see the room they are giiving me. Then I would negotiate for another room if it did not meet basic standards. We visited Florence, London, Paris, Venice and Rome. We stayed in some budget and midrange hotels that were extremely nice. This hotel was our only let down.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: pha123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during recent trip to Rome. Rooms were average but extremely clean. The bathroom was large and modern. We found the front desk clerk sleeping in the common room when we checked out which was somewhat humerous. They were pretty helpful overall. The hotel is pretty close to Rome Termini and also to a stop on the subway line so getting around was not to difficult especially because this hotel was a bit far from the main sights. Overall average hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Charming”
Reviews.Author: Ballmaster
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Assisted us in having our tour company come back to pick us up after we missed a pickup and in getting our transfer worked out at 4 AM. Also let us get breakfast early when we had early tour starting times. Adequate breakfast with hot and cold foods. Was there with my wife for 30th wedding anniversary. Very convenient to the Metro stop (Castro Pretorio), the Termini train and bus station, ATMs, and many small, moderately priced restaurants in the area. We felt safe walking around the area to find food, transportation, money, and souvenirs. Our room was small with a shower (not a tub) with a TV (some good reception and some bad), 2 phones. Our view was not great, but we were just there to sleep and eat breakfast when possible. The beds were very firm.

Reviews.Title: “Room was a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: Price: 65 EUR incl. full breakfast, online travel agent Location: close to station termini (5-10min walk), right near metro B Line Castro Pretorio (less than 5 min walk) Reception: not so friendly at first but did help us sort out staying a few extra nights Room: good, plenty space, bigh bathtub, comfy bed Breakfast: great by Itallian standards, scrambled eggs, yoghurt, bread, fruit, selection of hot drinks etc Pros: size of room, breakfast, proximity to termini, recommended a great restaurant 2 streets away Cons: no internet station

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: wedgeclose
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villafranca a convenient hotel for people who need a location close to transportation hub. No more than 6 blocks from the Termini which is the transit center of Rome. The hotel at first glance does not impress..located on a smalll street which at times resembles a used motorbike lot. There are some nice restaurants nearby and the staff is very helpful and accomodating. It is not centrally located to many of the sites in Rome but is easily accessible both by the Metro and busses. I would reccomend this hotel to the budget traveler. The rooms are small but are kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: aiki4me2
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, basic hotel, within a 2 minute walk to the Metro. The hotel had a very good complimentary breakfast each morning with cereal, pastries, eggs, yogurt, juices, etc., and probably after reading several earlier reviews, they now offer bacon and other breakfast meats! The front office staff spoke English very well, and were quite pleasant and helpful. We took their advice and booked a tour of the Vatican museum from them -- it was not with a great company and it could have been much better. That is my only negative comment. All in all, a positve experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel near the Train and subway stations”
Reviews.Author: Chopperpilot
Reviews.Content: Hotel 2mins walk to metro station 5 mins walk to Terminii Train Staition on a quiet side street. Close enough to walk to the historic sights. Good sized room with mini-bar/fridge and safe. Good western style bedding. Excellent bathroom with shower. Good buffet breakfast including sausage, eggs, bacon, breads, cheese,ham,cakes,fresh fruit, and cereals. !/2 block from a supermarket. Plenty nice restaurants in immmediate vicinity. Will definitely return here next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: shopkitten
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a stay at the Villafranca. It was very nice. It was well located for a first tip to Rome. We were able to walk to most key sites and we were very close to the metro at the station. Some guide books warn that the area around the station is a little seedy however there was no evidence of this near the Villafranca the area was lovely with fantastic restaurants within 5 mins walk. Breakfast was great and the service was good. However we booked through Expedia and I really felt we paid too much. We booked a superior room and I wish we hadn’t. It was pleasantly decorated but was exceptionally small it certainly wasn’t special. It was dark with only a small window that looked out onto a small courtyard of airconditioning vents. I have no idea how it was superior! Overall it was a good hotel and I had a nice stay, however I don’t actually think I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel 2mins metro station 5 mins Terminii in quiet side street.Good sized room with mini-bar/fridge and safe.Excellent bathroom with shower.Good buffet breakfast including Sausage,eggs,bacon,buns,cheese,ham,cakes,fresh fruit,and cereals.Plenty nice restaurants in immmediate vicinity.Will definitely return here next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wef
Reviews.Content: We stayed midweek at the Villafranca after booking through expedia. Overall, we had no problems at all with the hotel. It is about 5/10 mins walk from the main train station. A subway is 2 mins walk away. The room was fine, nicely decorated and a small bathroom. The breakfast was good too. Overall, we have no problems with the hotel and enjoyed staying there. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay in Rome and thoroughly enjoyed the Villafrance. It is close to the Termini and easy to catch buses to all of the attractions. Rooms were small but clean and adequate. The bathrooms were fabulous, big bathtub and heated towel racks. The complimentary breakfast was filling. The staff was helpful and spoke English. All in all it was a wonderful stay for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villafranca for 2 nights at the end of January. We were really impressed by the room as we were expecting it to be fairly small as usual with european cities. The staff were lovely and happy to help with any questions you have during your stay. The hotel is perfectly located a short walk from the termini station which is great for getting to and from the airport and also for the buses and metro service. The metro is great for value at 1 euro per trip but we did find that no matter what time of the day you got on it was crammed full. The sightseeing buses are brilliant for seeing all the sites as you can hop on and off but allow yourself a full day or its a waste of money. There are loads of restaurants near by but if your not sure where to go the reception will make you a reservation at one of there customers favourites! I would definately recommend the Villafranca to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service near train station.”
Reviews.Author: YorbaLinda15
Reviews.Content: Although our room was small, the bath was modern and clean. When we arrived late in the evening, before an early flight the next morning, the clerk offered to have a breakfast prepared for us to go, since we were leaving before the breakfast room opened. She also arranged transportation to the airport the next morning. We were pleasantly surprised with the service, because we booked the same day we arrived and had no prior knowledge of the Villafranca. A few blocks from the train station, it is not particularly close to the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bon01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villafranca in September for 03 nights. Really can't fault the hotel in anyway. We arrived quite late in the evening, and walked from Termini to the Hotel in about 5 minutes, and felt quite safe doing so. The staff were very helpful, and the hotel was very clean. Rooms were lovely and quite spacious - especially the bathrooms, which is quite a treat for Rome. Breakfast was good, with a selction of hot and cold food. We are planning a trip back to Rome in November and will definately be staing at the Villafranca.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Warwick370
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villafranca for 4 nights in August and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is ideally situated, about 5 minutes walk away from the Termini Station. All of the major sights are within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and all spoke good English. The room itself was lovely and clean with a very large bathroom. There was a wide choice for breakfast. We found it to be very good value for money. We would definitely recommend staying at the Villafranca.
